content:
Please execute the following task in my repository mcpmark-eval-zl/mcpmark-cicd:

I need you to create a comprehensive Pull Request automation workflow for this Node.js project. The project currently has no GitHub Actions workflows, so you'll be building a PR-focused CI/CD workflow from scratch that responds to pull request events. Here's what needs to be implemented:

## Pull Request Automation Workflow

Create `.github/workflows/pr-automation.yml` that triggers on `pull_request` events (opened, synchronize, reopened) with these jobs:

### 1. **code-quality** job (name: `code-quality`):
  - Runs ESLint checks using `npm run lint`
  - Runs Prettier formatting checks
  - Posts code quality results as PR comment (must include keywords: "Code Quality Report", "ESLint", "Prettier")

### 2. **testing-suite** job (name: `testing-suite`):
  - Runs full test suite with `npm test`
  - Generates test coverage report
  - Posts coverage summary as PR comment (must include keywords: "Test Coverage Report")
  - Uploads coverage artifacts

### 3. **security-scan** job (name: `security-scan`):
  - Runs dependency vulnerability checks
  - Scans for secrets in code changes
  - Creates security report as PR comment (must include keywords: "Security Scan Report", "Vulnerabilities", "Dependencies")

### 4. **build-validation** job (name: `build-validation`):
  - Attempts to build the application
  - Validates all endpoints are accessible
  - Creates deployment preview artifacts
  - Posts build status as PR comment (must include keywords: "Build Validation")

**IMPORTANT: All four jobs must run in parallel.**

## Implementation Requirements:

**Step 1: Create Feature Branch**
Create a new branch called `pr-automation-workflow` from main.

**Step 2: Create the Workflow**
Create `.github/workflows/pr-automation.yml` with proper YAML syntax:
- Appropriate triggers for pull_request events
- All four jobs configured to run in parallel
- Avoid identifier conflicts in github-script actions

**Step 3: Create and Merge Pull Request**
Create a comprehensive pull request and merge it to main:
- Title: "Implement Pull Request Automation Workflow"
- Detailed description of the workflow and its purpose
- Merge the pull request to main branch

## Important Notes:

- **All jobs MUST run in parallel**
- Ensure your PR satisfies ALL required checks
- The workflow should handle edge cases, have proper error recovery, and provide clear logging

Note: Based on your understanding, solve the task all at once by yourself, don't ask for my opinions on anything.

name: Install dependencies\\n        run: npm ci\\n        \\n      - name: Run tests with coverage\\n        id: test\\n        run: |\\n          npm test -- --coverage > test-results.txt 2>&1 || true\\n          echo \\\"test_output<<EOF\\\" >> $GITHUB_OUTPUT\\n          cat test-results.txt >> $GITHUB_OUTPUT\\n          echo \\\"EOF\\\" >> $GITHUB_OUTPUT\\n        continue-on-error: true\\n        \\n      - name: Upload coverage artifacts\\n        uses: actions/upload-artifact@v4\\n        with:\\n          name: coverage-report\\n          path: |\\n            coverage/\\n            test-results.txt\\n          retention-days: 30\\n        continue-on-error: true\\n        \\n      - name: Post Test Coverage Report\\n        uses: actions/github-script@v7\\n        with:\\n          script: |\\n            const testOutput = `${{ steps.test.outputs.test_output }}`;\\n            \\n            const comment = `## \ud83e\uddea Test Coverage Report\\n            \\n            ### Test Results\\n            \\\\`\\\\`\\\\`\\n            ${testOutput || 'Tests completed. Check artifacts for detailed coverage.'}\\n            \\\\`\\\\`\\\\`\\n            \\n            ### Coverage Artifacts\\n            \ud83d\udcca Coverage report uploaded as workflow artifact: \\\\`coverage-report\\\\`\\n            \\n            ---\\n            *Report generated by PR Automation Workflow*`;\\n            \\n            github.rest.issues.createComment({\\n              issue_number: context.issue.number,\\n              owner: context.repo.owner,\\n              repo: context.repo.repo,\\n              body: comment\\n            });\\n\\n  security-scan:\\n    name: security-scan\\n    runs-on: ubuntu-latest\\n    steps:\\n      - name: Checkout code\\n        uses: actions/checkout@v4\\n        \\n      - name: Setup Node.js\\n        uses: actions/setup-node@v4\\n        with:\\n          node-version: '18'\\n          cache: 'npm'\\n          \\n      - name: Install dependencies\\n        run: npm ci\\n        \\n      - name: Run dependency vulnerability scan\\n        id: audit\\n        run: |\\n          npm audit > audit-results.txt 2>&1 || true\\n          echo \\\"audit_output<<EOF\\\" >> $GITHUB_OUTPUT\\n          cat audit-results.txt >> $GITHUB_OUTPUT\\n          echo \\\"EOF\\\" >> $GITHUB_OUTPUT\\n        continue-on-error: true\\n        \\n      - name: Scan for secrets\\n        id: secrets\\n        run: |\\n          # Simple secret pattern detection\\n          echo \\\"Scanning for potential secrets...\\\" > secrets-results.txt\\n          if grep -rE \\\"(password|secret|key|token)\\\\s*=\\\\s*['\\\\\\\"][^'\\\\\\\"\\\\s]{8,}\\\" . --exclude-dir=node_modules --exclude-dir=.git >> secrets-results.txt 2>&1; then\\n            echo \\\"\u26a0\ufe0f Potential secrets found!\\\" >> secrets-results.txt\\n          else\\n            echo \\\"\u2705 No obvious secrets detected\\\" >> secrets-results.txt\\n          fi\\n          echo \\\"secrets_output<<EOF\\\" >> $GITHUB_OUTPUT\\n          cat secrets-results.txt >> $GITHUB_OUTPUT\\n          echo \\\"EOF\\\" >> $GITHUB_OUTPUT\\n        continue-on-error: true\\n        \\n      - name: Post Security Scan Report\\n        uses: actions/github-script@v7\\n        with:\\n          script: |\\n            const auditOutput = `${{ steps.audit.outputs.audit_output }}`;\\n            const secretsOutput = `${{ steps.secrets.outputs.secrets_output }}`;\\n            \\n            const comment = `## \ud83d\udee1\ufe0f Security Scan Report\\n            \\n            ### Vulnerabilities Check (Dependencies)\\n            \\\\`\\\\`\\\\`\\n            ${auditOutput || 'No dependency vulnerabilities found!'}\\n            \\\\`\\\\`\\\\`\\n            \\n            ### Secrets Scan\\n            \\\\`\\\\`\\\\`\\n            ${secretsOutput || 'Secret scan completed successfully!'}\\n            \\\\`\\\\`\\\\`\\n            \\n            ---\\n            *Report generated by PR Automation Workflow*`;\\n            \\n            github.rest.issues.createComment({\\n              issue_number: context.issue.number,\\n              owner: context.repo.owner,\\n              repo: context.repo.repo,\\n              body: comment\\n            });\\n\\n  build-validation:\\n    name: build-validation\\n    runs-on: ubuntu-latest\\n    steps:\\n      - name: Checkout code\\n        uses: actions/checkout@v4\\n        \\n      - name: Setup Node.js\\n        uses: actions/setup-node@v4\\n        with:\\n          node-version: '18'\\n          cache: 'npm'\\n          \\n      - name: Install dependencies\\n        run: npm ci\\n        \\n      - name: Build application\\n        id: build\\n        run: |\\n          npm run build > build-results.txt 2>&1 || true\\n          echo \\\"build_output<<EOF\\\" >> $GITHUB_OUTPUT\\n          cat build-results.txt >> $GITHUB_OUTPUT\\n          echo \\\"EOF\\\" >> $GITHUB_OUTPUT\\n        continue-on-error: true\\n        \\n      - name: Validate endpoints\\n        id: validate\\n        run: |\\n          echo \\\"Starting application for endpoint validation...\\\" > validation-results.txt\\n          # Start the application in background\\n          npm start > app.log 2>&1 &\\n          APP_PID=$!\\n          \\n          # Wait for application to start\\n          sleep 10\\n          \\n          # Test main endpoints\\n          if curl -f http://localhost:3000 >> validation-results.txt 2>&1; then\\n            echo \\\"\u2705 Main endpoint accessible\\\" >> validation-results.txt\\n          else\\n            echo \\\"\u274c Main endpoint failed\\\" >> validation-results.txt\\n          fi\\n          \\n          if curl -f http://localhost:3000/health >> validation-results.txt 2>&1; then\\n            echo \\\"\u2705 Health endpoint accessible\\\" >> validation-results.txt\\n          else\\n            echo \\\"\u26a0\ufe0f Health endpoint not accessible (may not exist)\\\" >> validation-results.txt\\n          fi\\n          \\n          # Cleanup\\n          kill $APP_PID || true\\n          \\n          echo \\\"validation_output<<EOF\\\" >> $GITHUB_OUTPUT\\n          cat validation-results.txt >> $GITHUB_OUTPUT\\n          echo \\\"EOF\\\" >> $GITHUB_OUTPUT\\n        continue-on-error: true\\n        \\n      - name: Create deployment preview artifacts\\n        run: |\\n          mkdir -p deployment-preview\\n          cp -r dist/* deployment-preview/ 2>/dev/null || echo \\\"No dist directory found, using source files\\\"\\n          cp package.json deployment-preview/ || true\\n          echo \\\"Deployment preview created at $(date)\\\" > deployment-preview/DEPLOYMENT_INFO.txt\\n        continue-on-error: true\\n        \\n      - name: Upload deployment artifacts\\n        uses: actions/upload-artifact@v4\\n        with:\\n          name: deployment-preview\\n          path: deployment-preview/\\n          retention-days: 7\\n        continue-on-error: true\\n        \\n      - name: Post Build Validation Report\\n        uses: actions/github-script@v7\\n        with:\\n          script: |\\n            const buildOutput = `${{ steps.build.outputs.build_output }}`;\\n            const validationOutput = `${{ steps.validate.outputs.validation_output }}`;\\n            \\n            const comment = `## \ud83c\udfd7\ufe0f Build Validation\\n            \\n            ### Build Results\\n            \\\\`\\\\`\\\\`\\n            ${buildOutput || 'Build completed successfully!'}\\n            \\\\`\\\\`\\\\`\\n            \\n            ### Endpoint Validation\\n            \\\\`\\\\`\\\\`\\n            ${validationOutput || 'Endpoint validation completed!'}\\n            \\\\`\\\\`\\\\`\\n            \\n            ### Deployment Preview\\n            \ud83d\udce6 Deployment artifacts available as workflow artifact: \\\\`deployment-preview\\\\`\\n            \\n            ---\\n            *Report generated by PR Automation Workflow*`;\\n            \\n            github.rest.issues.createComment({\\n              issue_number: context.issue.number,\\n              owner: context.repo.owner,\\n              repo: context.repo.repo,\\n              body: comment\\n            });\\n\", \"branch\": \"pr-automation-workflow\"}"}
